engine.configuration: 4-stroke horizontal single cylinder, 2 valves opposing each other (overhead exhaust valve, side intake valve)

elements.notes: The Normale is the first bike ever produced by Moto Guzzi

engine.configuration: 4-stroke horizontal single cylinder, 2 valves opposing each other (overhead exhaust valve, side intake valve)

elements.notes: The Sport uses the longer and lighter frame from te C 2V competition bike. The engine comes from the Normale but it's more refined. Some of the 4107 Sport manufactured have front brake.

engine.configuration: 4-stroke horizontal single cylinder, 2 valves opposing each other (overhead exhaust valve, side intake valve)

frame.rear_suspension: Swingarm with horizontal springs under the engine and friction dampers

elements.notes: The G.T. (also known as 'G.T. Norge') is the first Guzzi with a rear suspension. The solution adopted definitely increased comfort without decreasing the torsional strenght of the frame, essential to the handling of the bike. This excellent solution was later used in competition bikes The original G.T. sold 78 units from 1928 to 1930, it was replaced by the G.T. 16, with engine and frame derived from the Sport 15. 754 G.T. 16 were built. [Data refers to the G.T. 16]

engine.configuration: 4-stroke horizontal single cylinder, 2 valves opposing each other (overhead exhaust valve, side intake valve)

elements.notes: The Sport 14, compared to the original Sport, has bigger cooling fins on the cylinder and head on the engine, new front suspension with different steering geometry, better brakes and dynamo. 4285 Sport 14 were built.

engine.configuration: 4-stroke horizontal single cylinder, 2 valves opposing each other (overhead exhaust valve, side intake valve)

elements.notes: The Sport 15 introduces the over-the-frame fuel tank, an innovation initially introduced in british bikes only few years before. In addition to the new tank the Sport 15 has, compared to the Sport 14, a more rigid frame and other small improvements. 5979 Sport 15 were built.

engine.configuration: 4-stroke horizontal three cylinders, OHV 2 valves per cylinder

frame.rear_suspension: Swingarm with horizontal springs under the engine and friction dampers

elements.notes: Few prototypes models were built of this very advance bike (at the time). Only one model remains today (displayed in the Moto Guzzi Museum)

engine.configuration: 4-stroke horizontal single cylinder, OHV 2 valves
4-stroke horizontal single cylinder, OHV 2 valves
4-stroke horizontal single cylinder, OHV 2 valves
4-stroke horizontal single cylinder, OHV 2 valves

frame.rear_suspension: Swingarm with horizontal springs under the engine and friction dampers

elements.notes: The only difference between the V and the G.T.V. is the rear suspension with the adoption of the G.T.'s swingarm. In 1947 the G.T.V. was updated with the adoption of a upside-down telescopic fork.

engine.configuration: 4-stroke horizontal single cylinder, 2 valves opposing each other (overhead exhaust valve, side intake valve)
engine.feed_system: Carburetor, Amal type 6/142 or Dell'Orto MCS 25

engine.configuration: 4-stroke horizontal single cylinder, OHV 2 valves

frame.rear_suspension: Swingarm with horizontal springs under the engine and friction dampers

engine.configuration: 4-stroke horizontal single cylinder, OHV 2 valves

frame.rear_suspension: Swingarm with horizontal springs under the engine and hydraulic dampers

elements.notes: This version introduces telescopic front fork and hydraulic dampers on the rear swingarm.

engine.configuration: 4-stroke horizontal single cylinder, OHV 2 valves

frame.rear_suspension: Swingarm with horizontal springs under the engine and hydraulic dampers

elements.notes: This version introduces new engine's cylinder and head with valve covers.

engine.configuration: 4-stroke horizontal single cylinder, OHV 2 valves

frame.rear_suspension: Swingarm with horizontal springs under the engine and friction dampers

elements.notes: Better and more powerful engine. Friction dampers returns to the rear suspension.

engine.configuration: 4-stroke horizontal single cylinder, OHV 2 valves

frame.rear_suspension: Swingarm with horizontal springs under the engine and friction dampers

elements.notes: Last version of the Airone Sport

engine.configuration: 4-stroke horizontal single cylinder, OHV 2 valves

frame.rear_suspension: Swingarm with horizontal springs under the engine and friction dampers

elements.notes: Elegant version with smoother engine compared to the Sport version.

engine.configuration: 2-stroke inclined single cylinder

elements.notes: Cheap and simple moped born right after the WW2.

engine.configuration: 2-stroke inclined single cylinder

frame.rear_suspension: Swingarm with horizontal springs and friction dampers

elements.notes: Evolution of the Motoleggera 65. At the end of 1956 it was updated both esthetically (with new fenders and tank) and mechanically (with the introduction of a upside-down telescopic fork and better brakes)

engine.configuration: 2-stroke inclined single cylinder

frame.rear_suspension: Swingarm with horizontal springs and friction dampers

elements.notes: New engine and new style. It was sold in two variants: "Lusso" and "Turismo"

engine.configuration: 2-stroke inclined single cylinder

frame.rear_suspension: Swingarm with horizontal springs and rubber dampers

elements.notes: Last version of the Cardellino.

engine.configuration: 4-stroke horizontal single cylinder, OHV 2 valves

frame.rear_suspension: Swingarm with horizontal springs under the engine and hydraulic dampers

elements.notes: Evolution of the G.T.V. It was considered the quintessential touring bike, with very soft suspensions and torquey engine. In 1953 it was replaced by the Falcone Turismo

engine.configuration: 4-stroke horizontal single cylinder, OHV 2 valves

frame.rear_suspension: Swingarm with horizontal springs under the engine and friction dampers

elements.notes: The Falcone is the most famous Moto Guzzi bike of the 1950s and one of the most famous ever. From 1953 the Falcone was sold in two versions: "Sport" and "Turismo" (the latter replaces the Astore). The Falcone was also extensively use by the Italian police and army.

engine.configuration: 4-stroke horizontal single cylinder, OHV 2 valves

frame.rear_suspension: Swingarm with horizontal springs under the engine and friction dampers

elements.notes: Technical data is the same of the original Falcone (1950 - 1952). Over the years minor changes were introduced (both esthetically and mechanically).

engine.configuration: 4-stroke horizontal single cylinder, OHV 2 valves

frame.rear_suspension: Swingarm with horizontal springs under the engine and friction dampers

engine.configuration: 4-stroke horizontal single cylinder, OHV 2 valves

frame.rear_suspension: Single-sided swingarm with horizontal springs above the engine and friction damper

elements.notes: The Galletto was designed to combine the advantages of the scooter with the advantages of the motorcycle. The Galletto was the first scooter with motorcycle-sized wheels and was produced form 1950 to 1966, with increasing engine displacement (160cc, 175cc, 192cc).

engine.configuration: 4-stroke horizontal single cylinder, OHV 2 valves

frame.rear_suspension: Single-sided swingarm with horizontal springs above the engine and friction damper

elements.notes: The Galletto was designed to combine the advantages of the scooter with the advantages of the motorcycle. The Galletto was the first scooter with motorcycle-sized wheels and was produced form 1950 to 1966, with increasing engine displacement (160cc, 175cc, 192cc).

engine.configuration: 4-stroke horizontal single cylinder, OHV 2 valves

frame.rear_suspension: Single-sided swingarm with horizontal springs above the engine and friction damper

elements.notes: The Galletto was designed to combine the advantages of the scooter with the advantages of the motorcycle. The Galletto was the first scooter with motorcycle-sized wheels and was produced form 1950 to 1966, with increasing engine displacement (160cc, 175cc, 192cc). The 192cc model is the most refined. In 1961 was also introduced the electric starter and the friction damper was replaced by a idraulic damper.

engine.configuration: 2-stroke horizontal single cylinder

frame.rear_suspension: Swingarm with rubber pad acting as a spring and friction dampers

elements.notes: The first version was later called "Turismo" and in 1954 a "Lusso" version was introduced with different paint job and 17" wheels instead of the 19" of the original/Turismo version. From 1956 to 1959 only the Lusso version was manufactured.

engine.configuration: 2-stroke horizontal single cylinder

frame.rear_suspension: Swingarm with rubber pad acting as a spring and hydraulic dampers

elements.notes: Evolution of the Zigolo 98.

engine.configuration: 4-stroke inclined single cylinder, SOHC 2 valves

elements.notes: Also known as "Lodola 175", this bike was the Moto Guzzi's answer to the trend of the 175 cc sport bikes of the mid 1950s.

engine.configuration: 4-stroke inclined single cylinder, OHV 2 valves

elements.notes: Also known as "Lodola 235", this bike replaces the Lodola Sport with a bigger but simpler engine (switching back from SOHC configuration to a pushrod OHV)

engine.configuration: 4-stroke inclined single cylinder, OHV with parallel valves

elements.notes: After the introduction of the Stornello Sport in 1961 this version was called "Turismo".

engine.configuration: 4-stroke inclined single cylinder, OHV 2 valves

elements.notes: The engine of this Stornello version switched back to inclined valves.

engine.configuration: 4-stroke inclined single cylinder, OHV 2 valves

elements.notes: Between 1967 and 1969 it was sold under the name "Stornello America" with body style similar to the original Stornello. In 1971 a completely new redesign was introduce and the engine was updated with a 5-speed transmission instead of the 4-speed transmission of the previous models.

engine.configuration: 4-stroke inclined single cylinder, OHV 2 valves

elements.notes: In 1971 receives the same body style of the 125 model and here also the engine was updated with a 5-speed transmission.

engine.configuration: 4-stroke inclined single cylinder, OHV 2 valves

elements.notes: Together with the newly redesigned 125 and 160 models the Scrambler was introduced. It was also called "Stornello Regolarità".

engine.configuration: 4-stroke transversal 90° V-twin, OHV 2 valves per cylinder

frame.brakes: Rear drum brake, front duplex drum brake

elements.notes: The V7 Sport is one of the most famous motorcycles manufactured by Moto Guzzi. First bike to use the "Tonti" frame.

elements.notes: First models had the front brake of the V7 Special

elements.notes: The 750 S introduces a new style to the V7 Sport and also introduces the front twin disk brakes.

elements.notes: The 750 S3 introduces a new style to the V7 Sport and also introduces the front twin disk brakes.

frame.brakes: Rear drum brake, front twin duplex drum brake

elements.notes: First models were built using V7 Special engine and 4-speed transmission.

elements.notes: Available initially only with a 16" front wheel. The 16" front wheel made the bike very stable but not agile. In 1987 an upgrade was introduced that brought back the 18" front wheel and introduced a new front fairing.

elements.notes: The Otto Cilindri ('Eight Cylinders') is the most famous competition bike manufactured by Moto Guzzi and one of the most famous in the history of motorcycle competitions. In the 1950s the characteristics of the Otto Cilindri were unique, so its performance. In 1957 the refined engine was capable of 72 hp at 12000 rpm, incredible numbers at that time.
